text: This is a list of countries by employment rate, this being the proportion of employed adults in the working age. The definition of "working age" varies: Many sources, including the OECD, use 15–64 years old, but EUROSTAT uses 20–64 years old, the United States Bureau of Labor Statistics uses 16 years old and older (no cut-off at 65 and up), and the Office for National Statistics of the United Kingdom uses 16–64 years old. For comparability purposes, this article uses OECD statistics (where available). ==List== {| class="wikitable sortable" id="stats" |-valign=bottom ! Country !! style=width:6em;|Employment rate (%) !!
